intro: Sempervivum ibericum, commonly known as the Iberian houseleek, is a succulent plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming growth pattern. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color, often with a waxy coating. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring and summer months. Sempervivum ibericum is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
